intro: Scandix stellata, commonly known as the starleaf scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in wet meadows or along stream banks. Scandix stellata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its potential health benefits.
